summary: John J. Moriarty was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The documents do not specify his role within the HSCA, but his presence on payroll indicates he was a staff member.
significance: John J. Moriarty's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee responsible for investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll suggests he contributed to the committee's operations during its investigation.
